column1: Polynomial regular expression used on uncontrolled data
column2: A regular expression that can require polynomial time to match user-provided values may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.
column4: This expensive [["regular expression"|"relative:///lib/router.js:468:32:468:34"]] use depends on [["a user-provided value"|"relative:///lib/router.js:405:14:405:40"]].

column2: Misconfiguration of CORS HTTP headers allows for leaks of secret credentials.
column4: [["Credential"|"relative:///lib/router.js:574:17:574:73"]] leak vulnerability due to [["a misconfigured CORS header value"|"relative:///lib/router.js:554:22:554:39"]].

column2: Using indexOf to implement endsWith functionality is error-prone if the -1 case is not explicitly handled.
column4: This suffix check is missing a length comparison to correctly handle indexOf returning -1.
